page.title: 01Farming Area - River Alde
page.content: This area is all low lying being at most 60ft above sea level. Largely agricultural light sandy land growing wheat, barley, sugar beet, carrots, potatoes, vining peas, and dwarf beans all irrigated. There is one large and one small dairy cow herd. There is also a large area of forestry commission conifers on the lightest land, now mature and planted in 1920's. Small area of Sandling Heath. The main building is the Snape Maltings with the Aldeburgh Festival Concert Hall, craft, farm, tea, piano shops, and other tourist attractions. The marsh area floods in winter and is used for summer cattle grazing. Minimal agricultural work, many people work at the American Air Base at Bentwaters. In Blaxhall several cottages bought as retirement or second homes.
